column4: Please, how can I go somewhere to talk about C language and compilers on ubuntu?
There isn't anywhere specific for that; you can try here though
thanks. I'm starting to learn how to program in C
In the college the teacher only showed us how to compiler using dev C++ on windows
I use the Eclipse CDT for Ubuntu kernel development
You might also want to try anjuta
I'm still learning c language, what do u recomend for me?
The IDE you're most comfortable with, and *lots* of API documentation nearby, either web-sites or off-line copies of the APIs documentation you're using, and a *good* C/C++ language guide
Have you created a 'Makefile' for your project?
The Makefile needs a 'default:' or 'all;' target
http://tjworld.net/wiki/Programming/C/ExamplePrintArgsAndEnv
And how do I proceed? :/
Learn about GNU make, and Makefiles
on this URL there is information about these?
Just an example of a basic hello-world C program that prints the environment and args
I highly recommend you get something like this: http://www.dummies.com/WileyCDA/DummiesTitle/productCd-0764506919,page-1.html
okay I'll take a look on that page, thanks
It depends on the IRC client you're using.
It's XChat
You might want to look here, though: http://irclogs.ubuntu.com/2008/10/12/
I think xchat is logging by default, to ~/.xchat2/xchatlogs/
nice! thank you
